From the moment I posted in the Class of 2025 Facebook group back in September 2024, asking if anyone had started planning prom, I had no idea that simple question would lead me to take on the role of organizing the most unforgettable event of our seniors‚Äô lives. With no prior experience in planning something of this scale, I dove in headfirst‚Äîcompletely unaware of the amount of time, effort, and energy it would require. But I can confidently say: every second was worth it.

I began by touring Russo‚Äôs On The Bay in Howard Beach, NY‚Äîthe same stunning venue used by the classes before us. I was immediately greeted by Bert, who has been with Russo‚Äôs for over 24 years and is also a proud parent of a Class of 2023 Kellenberg alum. From the very beginning, Bert made me feel supported, informed, and inspired. He introduced me to Suzanna, who walked me through every detail‚Äîmenus, contracts, upgrades, ideas I hadn‚Äôt even thought of. Any questions, any concerns Suzanna was the Russo‚Äôs guru who was there for me every step of the way! So accommodating,  so available, whenever I needed her she was there! A complete and utter Godsend! I went in thinking I‚Äôd help coordinate a prom. What we ended up with? A full-blown dream event.

From that point on, Bert became my guiding light. Through his company, SGE DJ Entertainment, he offered a one-stop shop with everything‚ÄîDJ, lighting, MC, 360 Photo Booths, canyon blasts, robots, dance floor extras, you name it. And his wife Marcella of dolce couture candy, worked with vendors that SGE fully endorses to provide that one stop Shop benefit! she was an absolute miracle worker. She handled the coordination of the florals, added show-stopping extras (like the 6-foot ‚ÄúPROM 2025‚Äù marquee that wowed every guest), and was there for every single detail behind the scenes.

The night itself? Magic.
From the second guests walked into Russo‚Äôs, the energy was electric. The decor was stunning. The music had kids dancing nonstop‚Äînot one teen sat at their table for more than a few minutes. The MC kept the crowd engaged from beginning to end, and the entertainment was next level. Kids were on the 360 photo booth, posing with the robots, living their absolute best lives.

And Russo‚Äôs On The Bay? There are no words strong enough. Even Mr. Russo himself came in and designed our sit down plate with his top chef, Jeffrey Nathan, it  was nothing short of absolute perfection! The food‚Äîfrom cocktail hour to sit-down dinner to the out-of-this-world Venetian hour‚Äîwas phenomenal. Guests were blown away. The service was impeccable, but the real MVP? CHRISTINA, our ma√Ætre d‚Äô. She was everywhere‚Äîmaking sure the flow of the night was flawless, that every kid was where they needed to be, fed, safe, and happy. Her attention to detail and calm leadership made all the difference. She was, hands down, a superhero in heels.

What began as a simple plan to ‚Äúput together prom‚Äù turned into one of the most extraordinary events I‚Äôve ever been part of. With nearly 600 students in formal wear, I was naturally nervous‚Äîbut the team at Russo‚Äôs, SGE, and Dolce Couture Candy completely exceeded every expectation and made the entire nine-month process not only smooth, but truly enjoyable.

If you‚Äôre looking for the perfect venue with unmatched service from start to finish, food, and staff who know how to throw an unforgettable event‚Äînot just for adults, but for teenagers‚Äîlook no further than Russo‚Äôs On The Bay. And if you want a team that will make your vision a realistic dream that couldn‚Äôt have even imagined and guide you every step of the way? SGE DJ Entertainment and Dolce Couture Candy are the only way to go!

From the bottom of my heart, thank you to Mr. Russo, Bert, Marcella, Suzanna, Christina, and the entire team at Russo‚Äôs,  SGE and Dolce couture‚Ä¶ You made Prom 2025 everything and more. I will never forget it‚Äîand neither will our kids.

With endless gratitude,
Elaine K.
Prom Chair, Kellenberg Memorial High School Class of 2025

Listen, I‚Äôm not here to sugarcoat things‚ÄîI‚Äôm here to tell you that Russo‚Äôs on the Bay is THAT girl. Period. Our social service agency has been gracing this establishment for over a decade‚ÄîI‚Äôm talking so many events, I‚Äôve lost count. But last night? LAST. NIGHT. Hit different.

Why? One word: Sophia (she spelled it differently. Safiya I believe).

When I tell you this young lady understood the assignment, I mean she aced the exam, got extra credit, and was probably the teacher‚Äôs pet too. Our population consists of individuals with intellectual disabilities, meaning they require a different level of attentiveness, care, and patience. And let‚Äôs be real‚Äînot everyone is up for the task. But Sophia? She stepped up like a queen claiming her throne‚Äîsmiling, engaging, and treating everyone at our table like an individual. No rushed ‚ÄúWhat do you want?‚Äù energy. No exasperated sighs. Just genuine hospitality. She took drink orders like she was serving at the Ritz and brought back each one with grace and poise (because let‚Äôs be honest, some servers bring your drinks back like they‚Äôre mad at you). From start to finish, she delivered service smoother than a luxury car ride‚Äîand baby, that cappuccino she made? Life-changing.

Now, let‚Äôs talk about Russo‚Äôs itself. Because if you think this is just a banquet hall, think again.

First of all, shoutout to the staff who immediately let us know about the different bathroom options. Inclusivity? We love to see it. The Saint Patrick‚Äôs Day celebration was giving everything it was supposed to give‚Äîhats, funny glasses, the whole festive vibe. And then‚ÄîTHE FOOD.

üî• If you don‚Äôt get the penne a la vodka, are you okay?! This dish is a crowd favorite for a reason, and last night, we went back for seconds, thirds, and if I had no shame, maybe even fourths. If you‚Äôre looking for white-glove service, next-level hospitality, and food that makes you wanna write a love letter‚Äîbook Russo‚Äôs. And if you‚Äôre lucky enough to get Sophia at your table? Consider your night MADE.

The indoor spaces are just as impressive ‚Äî from the luxurious bridal suite to the crystal chandeliers and beautifully maintained ballrooms, everything radiates class and sophistication.

But what really sets Russo‚Äôs apart is the service. The staff was impeccable. Joe Vacca was relentless on making sure us and our guests had a great time. Our ma√Ætre d‚Äô and bridal attendant were incredibly attentive, making sure everything ran smoothly and that we felt relaxed and pampered the entire day. Every detail was executed perfectly ‚Äî from the timing of the ceremony to the flow of the reception.

The food was outstanding. The cocktail hour was nothing short of legendary. Our guests are still raving about the variety, quality, and sheer abundance of options, The dinner was equally delicious and beautifully plated. Russo‚Äôs doesn‚Äôt just serve a meal ‚Äî they create an experience.

Planning with Russo‚Äôs was also seamless. Jennifer was professional, responsive, and incredibly helpful throughout the entire process. We felt supported and heard from day one, and that made all the difference.

If you're looking for a venue that combines elegance, world-class service, and amazing food, Russo‚Äôs On The Bay is it. They helped make our wedding day absolutely perfect, and we‚Äôre so grateful for the memories they helped us create.

Highly, highly recommended!
